sub_title: Senior Leader | Transformational Leadership | Strategy & Innovation | Business development | Commercial & Operational Excellence | HR professional | Global Mobility
summary:
I am an international commercial and operational leader in the service/ hospitality industry, with a successful track record of driving industry change, strategy development, revenue outperformance and introducing leading edge tools and processes. 

For leaders, I’m the one who’s ahead of the game.  I utilize keen analysis and insights and a team approach to drive organizational improvements. I am an outgoing, flexible and reliable individual with excellent people skills. I am a well-motivated, focused and committed hard worker. I enjoy working towards a goal, always setting high standards and seeing tasks through to a sound conclusion. 
For clients, I’m the one they can trust and I will go above and beyond to make sure their experience has proven even better than expected. I am a people-oriented and a natural leader who is able to raise the bar of capability through the identification and development of talent pipelines across multiple cultures. I create confidence and I am a loyal and discrete worker. I am transparent and straight forward. An outspoken customer advocate with the ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders at any level.

SPECIALITIES:
Proven track record of hands on leadership experience, ability to collaborate, and follow up with critical communication to encourage strategic direction and influence business leaders.  An out-of-the-box thinker with extensive experience in:
•	increasing revenues & yield & revenue management
•	strong in establishing networks / sales (b2b & b2c)
•	marketing on- & offline / e-commerce
•	HR and all related tasks 
•	stakeholder & project & change management, agile, lean
•	legalizations, visa and immigration processes 
•	pre-opening skills
•	fundraising 
•	experience in working for a NGO

Recognized for developing mutually beneficial and sustainable owner and client relationships to strengthen and grow opportunities. Recognized for building strong and well balanced teams with whom I reached challenging goals and revenues. I have in depth knowledge of working with Government entities and Embassies.

profile_positions.title: Commercial / Business Development Director

profile_positions.description:
CIBTvisas is the global leader in travel visas and passports. 

In my role I was responsible for delivering the highly valued promises not only to our clients but also to our staff.  I managed the implementation of business guidelines and strategies, working with other excom members, to ensure everything did run smoothly. Why was I hired......to bring a much needed change from a highly process driven company to a customer & people orientated company. 

Directed and coordinated the internal structure of the organization, based on the company policies, quality & compliance regulations, goals and objectives to ensure an efficient working environment. I worked with a  enthusiastic team of approx. 150 people spread across different countries and offices.  During my time with CIBT, I build and established a sense of pride and strong morale within my team. I identified talents and promoted multiple team members. 

•	Set directions for the teams and prioritize activities and business plans for the Benelux
•	Lead and manage the entire scope of facility management tasks
•	End responsible for the Capex & Opex  & budget 
•	Ensuring quality remains high with SLA’s and internal audits and safety regulations are followed
•	Coach and train the management team
•	Identify and implement projects to improve and optimize systems
•	Improve customer satisfaction (target 97%)
•	Driving the business to increase profits 
•	HR responsible for the Benelux / Hiring & training new staff
•	Working collaboratively with Sales, Finance and European peers
•	Liaise with Embassies, Consulates and Visa Centers to ensure relationships

Achieved cost savings by optimizing office space and reducing personnel costs without loss of talent during industry’s most ambiguous and volatile phase.
profile_positions.title: Operations & HR Director for the Benelux

profile_positions.description:
The OWC stands for Overseas Women's Club Bangalore.  It is a social and charitable organisation in Bangalore. The NGO rsupports 20 Charities in and around Bangalore. The charities cover a wide spectrum of the underprivileged, including the destitute, terminally ill and HIV+patients, orphans, women in need, the elderly and physically and mentally challenged ones.

As VP Fundraising my job was;

-	To raise funds to support the 20 charities
-	To be the liaison between the local corporate society and the OWC
-	To create events which will produce substantial funds for the charities 
-       Work on marketing online and offline
-       Responsible for PR
-	 Member of the Executive committee 

Achievements:
-       Increased funds year over year (25%)
-       Signed multiple year contracts with mayor multinationals to ensure funds 
-       Created and implemented a new website
-       Created the OWC Mobile app to ensure connectivity with members and charities

company.name: Oakwood Asia Pacific / Oakwood Premier & Oakwood Residence Bangalore

profile_positions.description:
Heading the Sales, Revenue, Reservations & Marketing department of the Oakwood properties in Bangalore. Ensuring compliance with corporate strategy, initiatives and marketing programs, while ensuring that the company's financial goals and guest satisfaction objectives are achieved. Lead and develop a team of sales professionals and create a high quality brand image for the properties. Achieve all revenue objectives for the properties. 

Tasks: 
As Area Director of Sales, Revenue & Marketing I was responsible to develop the commercial teams into strong and professional individuals, which resulted in achieving the ambitious revenue budget, occupancy level and service targets. Create more brand awareness. Implemented a complete new progressive sales, revenue and e-commerce strategy together with a new game plane for the marketing (on- and off-line) for all properties. Integrated the sales teams into one powerful and bold team. Trained the team on being innovative and convincing sales professionals. 

Achievements:
* Increased revenue by 5% and occupancy by 8%. 
* Achieved highest Occupancy levels ever achieved with the UB City luxury property.
profile_positions.title: Area Director of Sales, Revenue & Marketing Asia Pacific Luxury properties

A unique corporation between 4 companies to create an even uniquer convention area/ location in Amsterdam. This corporation resulted in what is now called IJVenues.

2013

volunteer_experiences.description: During my stay for 4,5 years in India I became a member. It is a organisation that funds and serves the needs of over 20 charities in the greater Bangalore area. These charities cover a wide spectrum of the underprivileged, including the destitute, terminally ill patients, orphan, women in need and the elderly. Later on I worked for the NGO as their VP Fundraising.

This foundation was created in 2007 and the main goal was to  raise money for the "Time Out " chambers located in the medical center VU. These chambers were created in the medical center to help family members of patients that are undergoing treatment for cancer in the hospital. Not only the patient needs help to overcome his or her illness but also family members and people behind the patients have questions and perhaps need help. The noble cause of these chambers is to close that gap, answer questions and be there to help. These chambers are not funded by the hospital or get money form the government. The hotel and the foundation were introduced by a mutual friend to Professor Pinedo and the board of the foundation Time Out Chambers. Together we created a plan; a Mid Summer Night Gala to raise money. The first Gala took place in 2007 and raised over 150.000 euro for the chambers.
